com.example.habitup.Controller

Class HabitUpController

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.example.habitup.Controller.HabitUpController

  • public class HabitUpController
extends java.lang.Object
    HabitUpController is used for core functionality relating to Habits and HabitEvents. It is the primary controller linking the Views and Models, and is also often the layer between the app and ElasticSearch, through invocations to ElasticSearchController, for common and transactional operations.
    Author:
    @gojeffcho Javadoc last updated 2017-11-13 by @gojeffcho.

      • getTodaysHabits

        public static java.util.ArrayList<Habit> getTodaysHabits()
        Get all Habits that are scheduled to be done on the current day for the logged-in user. Used for MainActivity Habit list.
        Returns:
        ArrayList of today's Habits

      • addHabit

        public static int addHabit(Habit h)
                    throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Add a new Habit and send it to the DB.
        Parameters:
        h - Habit to be added
        Returns:
        int successCode (0 for success)
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if Habit name is not unique

      • editHabit

        public static int editHabit(Habit h,
                            boolean nameUnchanged)
                     throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Edit an existing Habit. If name was not changed, update existing Habit. If name was changed, check to ensure the new name is unique, then update the Habit accordingly.
        Parameters:
        h - Habit after edits
        nameUnchanged - True if name did not update - important for uniqueness check
        Returns:
        int successCode (0 for success)
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if name was changed but not unique

      • addHabitEvent

        public static int addHabitEvent(HabitEvent event,
                                Habit habit,
                                android.content.Context ctx)
        Add a habit Event to a Users local list and if we are connected to the internet Send to ES
        Parameters:
        event - event to be added
        habit - the habit of the event
        ctx - state of the app, fo connectivity check
        Returns:
        0 for success

      • addHabitEventLocal

        public static int addHabitEventLocal(HabitEvent event,
                                     Habit habit)
                              throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Add a habit event to the local list if it passes the error checking
        Parameters:
        event - event to be added
        habit - habit of the event
        Returns:
        0 for success
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the event was completed before the habit start date or if there is already a habit event with that date and type
